intro: Humiriastrum subcrenatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often have a blue-green hue, while the flowers are small and typically blue or purple. Humiriastrum subcrenatum is adapted to withstand drought and is often found in desert and semi-desert regions.
